bibl.note: This is a letter from C. Cooper to Adam Fergusson, dated June 14, 1826. Fergusson has been appointed agent for the Tennessee Bank in Smith County.

div.p:
You have been appointed agent of this Bank for the county of Smith to fill the vacancy occasioned by the resignation of Col Colonel
William Martin Enclosed you have a Bond which you will execute (if you should think proper to accept the appointment,) take the oath prescribed by the charter and forward the Bond to Bank without delay, proper certificates are required with regard to the solvency of your security
